intro: Meibomia abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian meibomia, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Meibomia abyssinica is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
